reviews.text: What a wonderful day that was when I visited to this museum. It was a very hot day so I decided to sit at the entry point for some time and till then the peoples siting there told me much more about this museum. There are many old stone God's sculpture. I was feeling that I'm in old era of North East India when I was looking around. A village with many peoples and a home with working women's. Peoples are very helpful inside the museum. The entry fee is not more than 20rs.

It presents the Assam heritage in the best possible way you can imagine. There are various sections within the museum. The Arms and Ammunition gallery is present in the groundfloor and is to the right when you enter the museum. The cultural art and history along with the Assam traditions and Music and Literature sections are spread in various parts.

There is also section of excavated idols and the miniature version of village life setup.

The auditorium within the museum conducts some programs on special occasion. The overall experience is great.

A museum in Northeast. One can get many knowledge of Assam traditional culture having artifacts, clothing of Ahoms ,And giant cannons of a kingdom. it should be maintained well and needed to be preserved more carefully the specimens. Tourists can visit. Good for kids also to get some study about it. Interesting for a person Who loves history.. No much penny cost for a ticket. i prefer to take your kids to the museum instead of taking much more time to the park. Hope This note may helpful to you.
One must visit,for proper observation it will take one half of the day. It has 4/5 different sections,each one is very very good.

It is a marvelous place to visit. It mirrors the rich and ancient social, economic and cultural values of the then Assam. The stone inscriptions and sculpture are testimony to the rich literary and cultural heritage of the earlier days. The negative part of the museum is its confinement to a small area and its inability to stretch.
Best place for a evening walk. Calm and quiet place with lots of lights.. Love to go there and hangout with friends. There are many restaurants nearby so you can have a meal after walking..

The place is good for having some relaxation. The lake is a big one, restaurant and the boating facility is available,  however,  the life jackets need to be changed, looks really old and dirty. Still many improvements are tet to be made, but its a good place to hang out in this city.

A perfect place for catching up with friends, to take walks, also a playground is available for the kids... Boating is also there but the life jackets are very old and smelly and needs to replaced, other things are clean and well maintained...
It's a very beautiful place. Digholi Pukhuri is one of the most beautiful place in guwahati city. Digholi Pukhuri is a Assamese word which means Longer lake.

It is a place for a pleasant blissful timepass. One can go with friends and family and spend time there.also there is a boating option which is also  a great experience. The lake is just walking distance from Guwahati railway station. So anyone having an hour's time can come here and have a good time here

Loved it. It is one of the best temples. It is also one of the oldest temples. it is more than 800 years old or might be even older than 800 years. Very delicate and artistic designs are made on the walls.

Karnak Temple

Big. Bold. Massively ambitious. 
This was Ancient Egypt’s grandest temple, covering over 2 sq km, large enough to contain 20 cathedrals.
A forest of colossal papyrus-shaped columns in the main hall is most spectacular. Truly impressive 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
Spirituality and the presence of Goddess. No corruption. Loved it. Will go again. Line starts from 5 am . Darshan starts from 8am sharp.

The place is very well known and always crowded and hence the experience has not been very good. Took about an hour to buy special ticket worth 500/-. Took about three hours to get inside the temple inspite of the pass/ticket. The temple inside though is extremely beautiful and holds a special significance.

It's worth one visit. But, don't fall for the Rs 501 special entry trap. We went on a Friday and it wasn't that crowded. We still bought this special ticket thinking it'll get us through the lines quickly. Turns out it just gets you through the first line quickly and then you are in line with everyone else. Also, keep cash ready because the priests ask you to offer money at every point. Took us about 2 hours to do the whole round.

Umananda is the smallest river island in the world. The place is very beautiful as it is located in the middle of almighty Brahmaputra. The temple here is to worship Shiva basically. Many tourists come here to see the temple. Besides the temple, people like me go there to enjoy the vibe. It feels very good to sit on the rocks and touching the water by your feet. A smooth breeze makes the time more beautiful. But now a days, sitting on the rocks, touching the water have been banned as some accidents have occurred there. So you might be missing that heavenly feel.

Umananda temple is situated in Peacock island,  in the midst of Brahmaputra river. Its the smallest river island in the world as well. 

Though its a religious place, its a tourist attraction being the smallest river island.It occupies a very smaller area but one can enjoy the scenic beauty sitting there on the rocky island. The boat to Island costs only 50 rupees per head. 

Anyone up to the smallest river island?

Very quiet and relaxing place provided there aren't much people around. And it's sad how visiting Umananda even after so many year the lone Golden Langur is still alive and lonely. Hope he is doing well, all by himself jumping around from one branch to another searching for someone he is never gonna find. Feel like it's a prison for him. Hope he is well.

An island in the river Brahmaputra. This is where the temple is situated. The only way to get to it is through a ferry. Be aware that there are two ferries, a government one where the ticket costs 20 Rs. and a private one where the ticket costs 250 Rs. The private one goes from a point called Pan  Bazaar (पान बाज़ार). So direct your vehicle accordingly.
The last ferry is around 5PM so be wary of the time.
The ferry takes about ten minutes to reach the island. A cable car is being implemented. Should be ready in about a year.
There are three temples in the island, the Umananda temple, a Hanuman temple and one more temple.
All are obviously small temples.
The island is supposed to have golden langurs, but we did not get to see any.
A good outing for a quiet evening.
Nice place, view is superb.  I loved it.  Everyone one should visit.  But one should be careful because sometimes it gets crowded. By the way it's a beautiful place with a great view of Guwahati.
The place is small, congested and almost always crowded, but I am giving it a 4 star because of the good food quality. The momo here is very good in the entire city.

Pocket friendly place for your favorite momos in Guwahati. All variety of momos are served here. The menu also includes fried rice, pork fries ans other dishes. Though the quality of service has gone a little low but the food remains finger licking good. Not a very upscale place but a momo lover can over look that. You can take away if you don't like the place.
Good ambiance, good food and they are very quick with the orders....

If you want to have worst momos in the world then this must be the one and only place. The momos are so thick and tasteless that you can't even finish the whole momo. It doesn't even deserve 1 star also. And guess what? They don't have any chutney to offer with the momos.
Momo taste is great. But shoup quality is poor. It could be better.

Great place for family meals. 1st thing which will amaze you....how the HUGE RESTURANT is creatively made of Bamboos 😋

You don't have to wait for even 2 min, guys are real quick in taking care of customers. If you are very fond of pork receipe, plz dry pork with bamboo shoots. That's really awsm. The real taste of Assamese cuisine you'll get it here👍
Tasty food good service.....excellent...
Good Restaurant

Good for ethnic assamese delicacies. There are many options to choose from duck, mutton, fish or chicken. The service is relatively quick. There is usually a rush as it has good parking option and situated at a good place. The food is good, tasty and worth every rupee. washroom needs improvement though. .

If you are hungry and at the same time searching for food which feels like home, then undoubtedly Heritage Khorikaa is the best place for you. Come and explore food with Assamese flavour. The environment and services both are good.

I was searching for below single star rating........
Nevertheless "Khorikaa "  really disappointed this time. 
 Having dinner on occasion of Holi.
But the Pioneer house who has a great role in introducing  "ethnic cuisine of Assam" to the rest of  India  this time couldn't be able to keep their brand name in all parameters .

There are many more to give a tough fight & could be able to  kick  out from the race.
Need back the old aroma and taste..... 

gud luck.
A must visit for people who wants to taste some assamese dishes.Food is tasty and has a good ambience too.People mostly visit with their families for dinner so that slot is slight busy.
Nice place for taking assamese foods. Delicious food quality.
Maach was a very good food destination for fish lovers but unfortunately it is closed
Conceptually very good place for epicurean fish eaters.
Nice epicurean
Binod tamang
Great place and awesome foods with good hospitality...a must try.

Terrible experience... Arrived in the evening of a weekday... With few friends and ordered Coupseuy.. The food they served was not what we ordered... They gave us over cooked noodles with not so cooked vegetables and the dish literally had no taste as in it was difficult to even gulp it... Later on we got a string of hair out of the main surving plate....and then when we ask the wait and told him, he totally denied it and blaimed us for it... This sort of experience was never expected and specially when the rate of the dishes are higher as compared to others.... Would Never Ever Visit The Place.

A lovely restaurant. The food is really good incredible and the service is even better!) So attentive but not overbearing. They really do go above and beyond to make it an incredible dining experience. Thank you so much for a lovely evening!!

Definitely would like to share my experience. It an amazing place. Good food , nice ambience and great service. You guys know the true meaning of hospitality. Keep the good work going. And keep the flag high.

this place was delivered  so yummy food. 
once I will order a pizza and white pasta. I really enjoyed.
interior was also awesome. it plays good role to make a day. . 
its a good combination. of Colors.
staff was also good . friendly behaviour.,friendly atmoshere.  
thanks for every thing.

This place is amazing. The top two buffet options in Chandigarh are Pirates of Grill and BBQ Nation. Not able to decide who's the best. You can go here for buffet and good time with your pals. 

Staff: 5/5
Staff is more than friendly.

Cleanliness: 4/5
Restroom is also OK if not the best. 

Variety of food: 4/5

Taste: 5/5

Liquor: 4/5

Bookings: 5/5
They have dedicated app for this on Google Play Store.

Overall, the best place for buffet in Chandigarh. Cheers.

Over priced for the menu they provide us with. Nice concept could be implemented in a lot better way. They can add more variety to the menu everyday. Getting in a out of Elante Mall is a lot of hassle. Not a spot for a quick visit. Staff is brilliant. Worth a visit if you have spare 1000 bucks to play with for just one person.
